alert.note: Alert for Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 6:18PM EDT until May 27 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tuckasegee River At Bryson City affecting Swain County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Tuckasegee River At Bryson City. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow. * IMPACTS...Between and 8.0 and 9.0 feet, the river will begin to overflow its banks and will start to move into the Bear Hunter Campground near Bryson City. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.5 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
